definition: to blacken/abbr. for 涅槃[nie4 pan2]
the great Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.
the Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.

sentences.english: The images of ascending immortals in Nirvana pictures are an expression of the increasing popularization of Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 涅槃昇仙圖像則是佛教進一步世俗化的表現。

sentences.english: If we can cultivate according to the Dharma that the Buddha spoke, then straightaway, we can realize the state of Nirvana.
sentences.chinese: 能依佛所說的法去修行，直截了當可達涅槃之境。

sentences.english: I can see many a City trader finding Nirvana there
sentences.chinese: 我能看到許多城市商人在這找到了涅槃。

sentences.english: There are of course numerous recessions of the Mahaparinibbana Sutra.
sentences.chinese: 有很多大般若涅槃經的古老版本。

sentences.english: Therefore joy is an obstacle in attaining higher stages to Nibbana.
sentences.chinese: 因此喜悅是在趣向更高層次涅槃聖果時的一種障礙。

sentences.english: In the state of no desire, we go beyond our life space into the realm of nirvana.
sentences.chinese: 無慾，則超越了我們生活的空間而進入涅槃界。
涅槃是一種無條件的狀態。

sentences.english: Samsara and nirvana are nothing but different manifestations of a basic continuum.
sentences.chinese: 輪迴和涅槃不過是相異表相的基本合體。

sentences.english: They say through sex you reach Nirvana.
sentences.chinese: 他們說，通過性，你將到達涅槃。
心是涅槃，衆生皆有佛性。

sentences.english: The knowledge accompanying nirvana is expressed through the word bodhi.
sentences.chinese: 有關涅槃的知識是通過菩提這個詞來表達的。

sentences.english: By putting the seven great nails of the narrow paths of samsara and nirvana.
sentences.chinese: 將七根大釘釘於輪迴與涅槃之狹路上。

sentences.english: Writing on this Mahayana understanding of Nirvana.
sentences.chinese: 對涅槃的理解寫在大乘經典上。

sentences.english: The Buddha in the Dhammapada says of nirvana that it is "the highest happiness".
sentences.chinese: 在法句經中佛陀說涅槃是“最高的幸福”。
